snippet: Andrew M. Cuomo made his first trip to Washington as governor to explain why New York needed billions of dollars to recover from Hurricane Sandy.
abstract: Gov Andrew M Cuomo makes his first trip to Washington, asking top administration and Congressional officials for billions of dollars in aid to help New York recover from the devastation of Hurricane Sandy; officials pledge support but it remains uncertain in the current political climate how much money will be provided New York, New Jersey and other states battered by the storm as Pres Obama and Congress hammer out an agreement to head off a possible fiscal crisis.
lead_paragraph: Andrew M. Cuomo made his first trip to Washington as governor to explain why New York needed billions of dollars to recover from Hurricane Sandy.

headline.seo: Cuomo in Washington Pressing for Disaster Aid
headline.main: Cuomo Travels to Washington to Press for Disaster Aid
headline.print_headline: Cuomo, in Washington for First Time as Governor, Presses for Billions in Storm Aid
